Articles.Title: My Top Xamarin Blogs and Online Communities
Articles.Description: We love all kinds of content here at Weekly Xamarin and this is another great list of resources for Xamarin blogs and online communities where we can all enjoy our love of this wonderful technology!
Articles.Author: Jean-Marie Parent

Articles.Title: Query & Interact with Apps in Android 11 with Package Visibility
Articles.Description: Android 11 introduced several exciting updates for developers to integrate into their app experience including new device and media controls, enhanced support for foldables, and a lot more. In addition to new features there are also several privacy enhancements that developers need to integrate into their application when upgraded and re-targeting to Android 11. One of those enhancements is the introduction of package visibility that alters the ability to query installed applications and packages on a userâ€™s device.
Articles.Author: James Montemagno

Articles.Title: Thinking Out Loud: Events, Messaging and Mvvm Navigation with XAML Frameworks
Articles.Description: This post from Nick carries on from a previous post we featured, and this time it takes advantage of C# 9 features to help reduce even more the code you have to write, winner!
Articles.Author: Nick Randolph

Articles.Title: OTP Auto-Fill Entry for iOS with Xamarin.Forms
Articles.Description: I was actually thinking about this exact feature recently when I benefitted from 2FA auto-fill on iOS, so really excited to see Gerald has written this excellent post showing us how to do it in Xamarin.Forms!
Articles.Author: Gerald Versluis

Articles.Title: 5 Tips to Easily Use the Grid for Layouts in Xamarin.Forms
Articles.Description: Grids are one of my favourite layouts in Xamarin.Forms and Leomaris is always a great teacher so this is excellent if you have found yourself shying away from grids.
Articles.Author: Leomaris Reyes

Articles.Title: Choose a Time Duration: Telerik TimeSpan Picker for Xamarin
Articles.Description: The Telerik TimeSpanPicker for Xamarin provides users with a quick and easy way to select a time duration, and the duration interval can be measured in days, hours, minutes and all the way down to seconds. Just like all other picker controls from the Telerik UI for Xamarin suite, TimeSpanPicker is highly customizableâ€”you can modify every part of the control, including the popup, spinners, header and footer as well as the displayed text before and after time interval is selected.
Articles.Author: Yana Kerpecheva

Articles.Title: PR Tracker for .NET projects
Articles.Description: This is a fun project from Microsoft MVP and .NET Foundation Board Member Layla Porter, that allows you to log and track your contributions to any open source .NET project marked with the Hacktoberfest label. Not only can you use it to track your contributions but the project can also be found on [GitHub](https://github.com/layla-p/hacktoberfestproject) and openly welcomes PR's so you can even track work you have done on the tracker project, meta!
Articles.Author: Layla Porter

Articles.Title: Using Styles in Xamarin.Forms: Implicit, Explicit and Inherit Styles
Articles.Description: Xamarin.Forms applications often contain multiple controls that have a similar appearance. Setting the appearance of each individual control can be repetitive and error prone. With styles you can make your XAML less verbose and the maintenance of the look and feel of your Xamarin.Forms app much simpeler. In this video we will learn how to use implicit styles, explicit styles, style inheritance and how to make styles apply to your own custom controls.
Articles.Author: Gerald Versluis

Articles.Title: Merge Conflict: 223: How App Updates Work
Articles.Description: How to app updates work, what do you need to know, migrate, and hook into? Or do you need to at all?

Articles.Title: XamExpertDay 2020 Live Stream : Full Day Deep-Dive Xamarin Content
Articles.Description: Here you can find all the sessions from the XamExpertDay 2020 live event. XamExpertDay is a full day of in-depth Xamarin sessions and was a really great day with fantastic speakers.
